title: Carpenter Park, Carpentersville
text:
Carpenter Park is a <a href="Park%23Urban%20parks">park</a> in <a href="Carpentersville%2C%20IL">Carpentersville, IL</a>, a <a href="Chicago%20metropolitan%20area">suburb of Chicago</a>. It was established in the 1850s and spans 20 <a href="acre">acre</a>s. Community festivals, pick-up <a href="Sport">sporting events</a>, and ceremonies are often held in Carpenter Park due to its size.
Renovation.
Carpenter Park is currently being <a href="Renovation">renovated</a>. The project started in April 2013, and has a $1 million budget. Many things were added and will be added, including new playground equipment and a <a href="gazebo">gazebo</a>. The mission of these renovations are "...to increase the attractiveness and diversity of the <a href="Amenity">amenities</a> in the parks system."
